sentences.en: Aggressive youngsters with these clothes on walk like the soldier who lost the commander, ungainly slouching.
sentences.cn: 年轻的愣头青们穿着这样的衣服走在街上,就像散兵游勇, 邋里邋遢.

sentences.en: First off, both people have to sit off to the side of the display, which can cause leaning, slouching, and twisting to get into a position to both see and type.
sentences.cn: 首先，两个人都并非正对显示器，而是偏向显示器的边缘，在敲打键盘或观察显示器时，将会引起相互倚靠、懒散及扭头等情况的发生。

sentences.en: He acquired a slouching gait, and ignoble look.
sentences.cn: 他学了一套萎靡不振的走路样子和一种不体面的神气.

sentences.en: He was tall and bulky, but he walked with a slouching gait.
sentences.cn: 他身材高大, 但是走起路来却是无精打采的样子.

sentences.en: Michael: You think I am slouching when I stand?
sentences.cn: 迈克尔: 你觉得我站的时候站不直?

sentences.en: Proper standing posture, no slouching and do lean against the wall.
sentences.cn: 端正站姿, 不要无精打采或者靠在墙上.

sentences.en: What do you think you are doing slouching parade ground like a bay of rags?
sentences.cn: 像一袋破布一样零零散散、没精打采地走过排练场,你们以为你们在干什么?

sentences.en: Yet, in spite of its awkward, slouching gait, the hyena can run surprisingly quickly.
sentences.cn: 鬣狗的步履笨拙, 懒散, 然而跑起来速度惊人.

words.tran_cn: 下垂；笨拙的人，懒散的人；懒散的样子

trans.tran_cn: 无精打采地立、坐或行走( slouch的现在分词 )
